cmp: 匕 (an ancient type of spoon, dagger/ladle)
mng: to ride, to mount, to make use of, to avail oneself of, to take advantage of, to multiply (mathematics), Buddhist sect or creed
four horse military chariot (archaic), four (archaic), generic term for history books

exm.mng: to follow up a victory and press home the attack, to pursue retreating enemy
to ride as a passenger, to travel by (car, plane etc)
to cool off in the shade
Mahayana, the Great Vehicle, Buddhism based on the Mayahana sutras, as spread to Central Asia, China and beyond
attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc
to seize the opportunity, to strike while the iron is hot
